ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: See above answer. This is a class about modern Iran taught in Persian. If you study anything to do with Iran, you should probably take it. If not, well, you won't have the skills, so don't bother.
Yes, I would definitely recommend this course to other students looking to work with primary sources and learn how to perform historically minded textual analysis.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: As I study modern Iran (in part) and hope to use Persian sources in my work, this class was an invaluable introduction to both the themes and methods of modern Iranian history.
This course contributed greatly to the development of my future research because it covered a wide rang of primary source material that is essential to any project of 19th or 20th century Iran.
